text: Conus antoniaensis is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones. These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans. ==Description== The size of the shell varies between 11 mm and 30 mm. ==Distribution== This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off Boa Vista Island, Cape Verde. ==References== * Cossignani T. & Fiadeiro R. (2014). Quattro nuovi coni da Capo Verde. Malacologia Mostra Mondiale. 83: 14-19 * Cossignani T. & Fiadeiro R. (2018). Quattro nuovi coni da Capo Verde. Malacologia Mostra Mondiale. 98: 14-20. ==External links== * To World Register of Marine Species * Cone Shells - Knights of the Sea * antoniaensis Category:Gastropods described in 2014 Category:Gastropods of Cape Verde Category:Fauna of Boa Vista, Cape Verde
title: Conus antoniaensis
